titles.title: To authorize the exchange of certain land located in Gulf Islands National Seashore, Jackson County, Mississippi, between the National Park Service and the Veterans of Foreign Wars, and for other purposes.
Gulf Islands National Seashore Land Exchange Act of 2016

Referred to the Subcommittee on Federal Lands.
Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.
Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.

calendar.text: Ordered to be Reported (Amended) by Unanimous Consent.

action.text: Reported (Amended) by the Committee on Natural Resources. H. Rept. 114-441.

calendar.text: Placed on the Union Calendar, Calendar No. 337.

action.text: Mr. McClintock moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 4119.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
Received in the Senate and Read twice and referred to the Committee on Energy and Natural Resources.
Committee on Energy and Natural Resources Senate Subcommittee on National Parks. Hearings held.

calendar.text: Committee on Energy and Natural Resources. Ordered to be reported with an amendment favorably.

action.text: Committee on Energy and Natural Resources. Reported by Senator Murkowski with amendments. With written report No. 114-340.

calendar.text: Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 611.

committee.subcommittee: National Parks, Forests, and Public Lands
committee.name: House Natural Resources

bill.summary:
Gulf Islands National Seashore Land Exchange Act of 2016
(Sec. 2) This bill authorizes the Department of the Interior, through the National Park Service, to convey to the Veterans of Foreign Wars Post 5699 approximately 1.542 acres of real property located within the Gulf Islands National Seashore in Jackson County, Mississippi, in exchange for a parcel of 2.161 acres.
The values of the parcels of real property to be exchanged shall be equal, as determined by an appraisal conducted:
by a qualified and independent appraiser, and in accordance with nationally recognized appraisal standards. If the values of such parcels of real property are not equal, their values shall be equalized through:
a cash payment, or adjustments to their acreage. Interior shall require the Post to cover Interior's costs to carry out the land exchange or to reimburse Interior for them. If Interior collects amounts from the Post in advance of incurring the actual costs, it shall refund to the Post any amount in excess of those costs.
The bill subjects the exchange to valid existing rights.
Land and interests acquired by the United States by this bill shall be administered as part of the Gulf Islands National Seashore.
Interior shall modify the boundaries of the Gulf Islands National Seashore to reflect such land exchange upon its completion.
